name: http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/Firewall
desc: This service provides access to firewall settings on a router.

GetALGSettings.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetALGSettings
GetALGSettings.desc: This action gets the router's current ALG settings.

isSIPEnabled.desc: Whether the router's SIP ALG feature is currently enabled.

GetDMZSettings.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetDMZSettings
GetDMZSettings.desc: This action gets the router's current DMZ settings.

isDMZEnabled.desc: Whether the router's DMZ feature is currently enabled.

sourceRestriction.desc: The range of IP addresses that can access the destination server in the DMZ. If the value of the isDMZEnabled parameter is false, this value will not be present. If the value of the isDMZEnabled parameter is true and the sourceRestriction parameter is not present, all IP addresses are allowed to access the destination server.

destinationIPAddress.desc:
The destination server's IP address on the LAN. If the value of the isDMZEnabled parameter is false, this value will not be present. Otherwise, it will be present if and only if the destinationMACAddress parameter is not present. This value must be in the same subnet as the router's LAN host address (as defined by SetLANSettings), but not equal to the router's LAN host address and not fall inside the following reserved ranges:
          Address Block
              Description
              Reference
            192.168.1.0/24: 192.168.1.0
              Subnetwork ID
              RFC 922, Section 7
            192.168.1.0/24: 192.168.1.255
              Subnetwork Broadcast Address
              RFC 922, Section 7

destinationMACAddress.desc: The destination server's MAC address. If the value of the isDMZEnabled parameter is false, this value will not be present. Otherwise, it will be present if and only if the destinationIPAddress parameter is not present.

GetFirewallSettings.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetFirewallSettings
GetFirewallSettings.desc: This action gets the router's current firewall settings.

isIPv4FirewallEnabled.desc: Whether the IPv4 firewall is currently enabled.

isIPv6FirewallEnabled.desc: Whether the IPV6 firewall is currently enabled.

blockMulticast.desc: Whether the firewall currently blocks multicasts.

blockNATRedirection.desc: Whether the firewall currently blocks NAT redirections.

blockIDENT.desc: Whether the firewall currently blocks IDENT requests (port 113).

blockAnonymousRequests.desc: Whether the firewall currently blocks anonymous requests from the WAN, such as ping.

blockIPSec.desc: Whether the firewall currently blocks IPSec traffic.

blockPPTP.desc: Whether the firewall currently blocks PPTP traffic.

blockL2TP.desc: Whether the firewall currently blocks L2TP traffic.

GetIPv6FirewallRules.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetIPv6FirewallRules
GetIPv6FirewallRules.desc: This action gets the list of rules regarding port/protocol combinations that are allowed to reach specific IPv6 destinations on the LAN through the firewall.

rules.desc: The current list of IPv6 firewall rules.

maxPortRanges.desc: The maximum number of port ranges that can be specified by a single IPv6 firewall rule.

maxDescriptionLength.desc: The maximum length, in bytes, of the description member of an IPv6 firewall rule.

maxRules.desc: The maximum number of IPv6 firewall rules that can exist simultaneously.

GetPortRangeForwardingRules.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetPortRangeForwardingRules
GetPortRangeForwardingRules.desc: This action gets the list of port range forwarding rules currently set on the router.

rules.desc: The current list of port range forwarding rules.

maxDescriptionLength.desc: The maximum length, in bytes, of the description member of a port range forwarding rule.

maxRules.desc: The maximum number of port range forwarding rules that can exist simultaneously.

GetPortRangeTriggeringRules.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetPortRangeTriggeringRules
GetPortRangeTriggeringRules.desc: This action gets the list of port range triggering rules currently set on the router.

rules.desc: The current list of port range triggering rules.

maxDescriptionLength.desc: The maximum length, in bytes, of the description member of a port range triggering rule.

maxRules.desc: The maximum number of port range triggering rules that can exist simultaneously.

GetSinglePortForwardingRules.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetSinglePortForwardingRules
GetSinglePortForwardingRules.desc: This action gets the list of single-port forwarding rules currently set on the router.

rules.desc: The current list of single-port forwarding rules.

maxDescriptionLength.desc: The maximum length, in bytes, of the description member of a single-port forwarding rule.

maxRules.desc: The maximum number of single-port forwarding rules that can exist simultaneously.

SetALGSettings.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetALGSettings
SetALGSettings.desc: This action sets the router's ALG settings.

isSIPEnabled.desc: Whether the router's SIP ALG feature should be enabled.

SetDMZSettings.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetDMZSettings
SetDMZSettings.desc: This action sets the router's DMZ settings.

isDMZEnabled.desc: Whether the router's DMZ feature should be enabled.

sourceRestriction.desc: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to access the destination server in the DMZ. If the value of the isDMZEnabled parameter is false, this value is ignored. Otherwise, if this value is not present, all IP addresses will be allowed to access the destination server.

destinationIPAddress.desc:
The destination server's IP address on the LAN. If the value of the isDMZEnabled parameter is false, this value is ignored. Otherwise, either this parameter or the destinationMACAddress parameter, but not both, must be specified. This value must be in the same subnet as the router's LAN host address (as defined by SetLANSettings), but not equal to the router's LAN host address and not fall inside the following reserved ranges:
          Address Block
              Description
              Reference
            192.168.1.0/24: 192.168.1.0
              Subnetwork ID
              RFC 922, Section 7
            192.168.1.0/24: 192.168.1.255
              Subnetwork Broadcast Address
              RFC 922, Section 7

destinationMACAddress.desc:
The destination server's MAC address. If the value of the isDMZEnabled parameter is false, this value is ignored. Otherwise, either this parameter or the destinationIPAddress parameter, but not both, must be specified. The following restrictions from the IANA are applied to the destination MAC address. The destination MAC address must not fall inside the following reserved ranges:
          Address Block
              Description
              Reference
            00:00:00:00:00:00-00:00:00:00:03:00
              Reserved
              RFC 5342
            01:00:5e:00:00:00-01:00:5e:7F:FF:FF
              IPv4 multicast range
              RFC 1122
            01:00:5e:80:00:00-01:00:5e:8F:FF:FF
              MPLS multicast range
              RFC 5332
            01:00:5e:90:00:00
              draft-ietf-mpls-tp-ethernet-addressing
              
            FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF
              Broadcast address
              RFC 5342

errors.ErrorInvalidDestinationIPAddress: The specified destination server IP Address was invalid.
errors.ErrorInvalidDestinationMACAddress: The specified destination server MAC address was invalid.
errors.ErrorInvalidSourceRestriction: The first IP address in the specified source restriction range is invalid, or the last IP address in the range is less than the first IP address in the range.
errors.ErrorMissingDestination: Neither a destination server IP address nor a destination server MAC address were specified.
errors.ErrorMultipleDestinations: Both a destination server last IP address and a destination server MAC address were specified.

SetFirewallSettings.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetFirewallSettings
SetFirewallSettings.desc: This action sets the router's firewall settings.

isIPv4FirewallEnabled.desc: Whether the IPv4 firewall should be enabled.

isIPv6FirewallEnabled.desc: Whether the IPV6 firewall should be enabled.

blockMulticast.desc: Whether the firewall should block multicasts.

blockNATRedirection.desc: Whether the firewall should block NAT redirections.

blockIDENT.desc: Whether the firewall should block IDENT requests (port 113).

blockAnonymousRequests.desc: Whether the firewall should block anonymous requests from the WAN, such as ping.

blockIPSec.desc: Whether the firewall should block IPSec passthrough.

blockPPTP.desc: Whether the firewall should block PPTP passthrough.

blockL2TP.desc: Whether the firewall should block L2TP passthrough.

SetIPv6FirewallRules.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetIPv6FirewallRules
SetIPv6FirewallRules.desc: This action sets the list of IPv6 firewall rules on the router. Any existing rules are completely replaced by the specified values.

rules.desc: The desired list of IPv6 firewall rules.

errors.ErrorDescriptionTooLong: One of the specified descriptions was longer than the maximum allowed length.
errors.ErrorInvalidPort: One of the specified ports was not between 0 and 65535.
errors.ErrorInvalidPortRange: One of the specified port ranges contained a first value that was greater than its last value.
errors.ErrorNoPortRanges: One of the specified rules contained no port ranges.
errors.ErrorRulesOverlap: Multiple rules were specified for a single port/protocol combination to the same IPv6 address.
errors.ErrorTooManyPortRanges: One of the specified rules contained more than the maximum allowed number of port ranges.
errors.ErrorTooManyRules: The specified list of IPv6 firewall rules contains more than the maximum allowed number of rules.

SetPortRangeForwardingRules.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetPortRangeForwardingRules
SetPortRangeForwardingRules.desc: This action sets the list of port range forwarding rules on the router. Any existing rules are completely replaced by the specified values.

rules.desc: The desired list of port range forwarding rules.

errors.ErrorDescriptionTooLong: One of the specified descriptions was longer than the maximum allowed length.
errors.ErrorInvalidExternalPort: One of the specified external ports was not between 0 and 65535.
errors.ErrorInvalidExternalPortRange: One of the specified external port ranges contained a first value that was greater than its last value.
errors.ErrorInvalidInternalServerIPAddress: One of the specified internal server IP addresses was invalid.
errors.ErrorRulesOverlap: Multiple rules were specified for a single external port/protocol combination.
errors.ErrorTooManyRules: The specified list of port range forwarding rules contains more than the maximum allowed number of rules.

SetPortRangeTriggeringRules.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetPortRangeTriggeringRules
SetPortRangeTriggeringRules.desc: This action sets the list of port range triggering rules on the router. Any existing rules are completely replaced by the specified values.

rules.desc: The desired list of port range triggering rules.

errors.ErrorDescriptionTooLong: One of the specified descriptions was longer than the maximum allowed length.
errors.ErrorInvalidForwardedPort: One of the specified forwarded ports was not between 0 and 65535.
errors.ErrorInvalidForwardedPortRange: One of the specified forwarded port ranges contained a first value that was greater than its last value.
errors.ErrorInvalidTriggerPort: One of the specified trigger ports was not between 0 and 65535.
errors.ErrorInvalidTriggerPortRange: One of the specified trigger port ranges contained a first value that was greater than its last value.
errors.ErrorRulesOverlap: Multiple rules were specified for a single port.
errors.ErrorTooManyRules: The specified list of port range triggering rules contains more than the maximum allowed number of rules.

SetSinglePortForwardingRules.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetSinglePortForwardingRules
SetSinglePortForwardingRules.desc: This action sets the list of single-port forwarding rules on the router. Any existing rules are completely replaced by the specified values.

rules.desc: The desired list of single-port forwarding rules.

errors.ErrorDescriptionTooLong: One of the specified descriptions was longer than the maximum allowed length.
errors.ErrorInvalidExternalPort: One of the specified external ports was not between 0 and 65535.
errors.ErrorInvalidInternalPort: One of the specified internal server ports was not between 0 and 65535.
errors.ErrorInvalidInternalServerIPAddress: One of the specified internal server IP addresses was invalid.
errors.ErrorRulesOverlap: Multiple rules were specified for a single external port/protocol combination.
errors.ErrorTooManyRules: The specified list of single-port forwarding rules contains more than the maximum allowed number of rules.

firstPort.desc: The first port in the range. This value must be between 0 and 65535.

lastPort.desc: The last port in the range. This value must be between 0 and 65535.

firstExternalPort.desc: The first external port in the range that should be forwarded. This value must be between 0 and 65535.

lastExternalPort.desc: The last external port in the range that should be forwarded. This value must be between 0 and 65535.

protocol.desc: The protocol that should be forwarded.

internalServerIPAddress.desc:
The IP address of the destination server on the LAN. This value must be in the same subnet as the router's LAN host address (as defined by SetLANSettings), but not equal to the router's LAN host address and not fall inside the following reserved ranges:
          Address Block
              Description
              Reference
            192.168.1.0/24: 192.168.1.0
              Subnetwork ID
              RFC 922, Section 7
            192.168.1.0/24: 192.168.1.255
              Subnetwork Broadcast Address
              RFC 922, Section 7

description.desc: A human-readable description of the rule.

externalPort.desc: The external port that should be forwarded. This value must be between 0 and 65535.

protocol.desc: The protocol that should be forwarded.

internalServerIPAddress.desc:
The IP address of the destination server on the LAN. This value must be in the same subnet as the router's LAN host address (as defined by SetLANSettings), but not equal to the router's LAN host address and not fall inside the following reserved ranges:
          Address Block
              Description
              Reference
            192.168.1.0/24: 192.168.1.0
              Subnetwork ID
              RFC 922, Section 7
            192.168.1.0/24: 192.168.1.255
              Subnetwork Broadcast Address
              RFC 922, Section 7

internalPort.desc: The port number of the destination server on the LAN. This value must be between 0 and 65535.

description.desc: A human-readable description of the rule.

firstTriggerPort.desc: The first port in the range that should be trigger the rule. This value must be between 0 and 65535.

lastTriggerPort.desc: The last port in the range that should be trigger the rule. This value must be between 0 and 65535.

firstForwardedPort.desc: The first port in the range that should be forwarded by the rule. This value must be between 0 and 65535.

lastForwardedPort.desc: The last port in the range that should be forwarded by the rule. This value must be between 0 and 65535.

description.desc: A human-readable description of the rule.

ipv6Address.desc: The IPv6 address of the desination for which the traffic should be allowed.

portRanges.desc: The list of port/protocol combinations that should be allowed. This list must contain at least one port range.

description.desc: A human-readable description of the rule.

firstIPAddress.desc:
The first IP address in the range. The following restrictions from RFC 5735 are applied to the first IP address. The first IP address must not fall inside the following reserved ranges:
          Address Block
              Description
              Reference
            0.0.0.0/8
              "This" Network
              RFC 1122, Section 3.2.1.3
            127.0.0.0/8
              Loopback
              RFC 1122, Section 3.2.1.3
            169.254.0.0/16
              Link Local
              RFC 3927
            224.0.0.0/4
              Multicast
              RFC 3171
            240.0.0.0/4
              Reserved for Future Use
              RFC 1112, Section 4
            255.255.255.255/32
              Limited Broadcast
              RFC 919, Section 7  RFC 922, Section 7

lastIPAddress.desc:
The last IP address in the range. The following restrictions from RFC 5735 are applied to the last IP address. This value must be greater than or equal to the firstIPAddress value and not fall inside the following reserved ranges:
          Address Block
              Description
              Reference
            0.0.0.0/8
              "This" Network
              RFC 1122, Section 3.2.1.3
            127.0.0.0/8
              Loopback
              RFC 1122, Section 3.2.1.3
            169.254.0.0/16
              Link Local
              RFC 3927
            224.0.0.0/4
              Multicast
              RFC 3171
            240.0.0.0/4
              Reserved for Future Use
              RFC 1112, Section 4
            255.255.255.255/32
              Limited Broadcast
              RFC 919, Section 7  RFC 922, Section 7

IPProtocol.Both: Both the TCP and UDP protocols.
